Text.Value: Move away, reaching for your weapon.
...But instead of them, Edowin found an owlbear. An angry one.

EditorData.NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

Text.Value: He's hurt badly. An owlbear got him deep. If there's anything you can do...
I killed an owlbear nearby. If that's what attacked your brother, consider him avenged.
I suppose... I suppose he'd want us to go on - find a way to honour his sacrifice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reasoning with himself. 'It's what Edowin would have wanted.'

Text.Value: Forget the owlbear. You're still alive - so go.
These fugitives - tell me more.
That fellow had a tadpole in his head, and they consider him blessed? Chosen? What madness is this?
Why are you out here? The wilderness is dangerous.
I'm sorry, True Soul. I... only repeated what I thought I knew.
A True Soul. Thank the Absolute. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Wait.
I'm watching you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Andrick and Brynna leave, setting off to continue their patrol mission (they vanish off-stage permanently once out of view) or to go to the mouth of the owlbear cave, where the players can meet them again, In either case, they'll move in the same direction.

Text.Value: True Soul?
Edowin. Ed! Please!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.
EditorData.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin

Text.Value: Hold his stare.
I don't take orders from cowering children.
Stay quiet, keeping a careful eye on them.
Raise a brow. You aren't impressed.
Glower at them.
Freeze and hold up your hands.
Try to block him out.
And just... leave Ed?
I don't serve, and I don't rule. With or without tadpole.
Really? You killed that thing?

EditorData.NodeContext: Amazed

Text.Value: I told Edowin not to look in that cave - it was filthy with owlbear tracks.
*Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*
We were looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.
*A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
What are you doing?! Your sword, brother. Now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Player is attempting to psionically infiltrate her mind

Text.Value: I will go where I wish.
You! Not a step closer.

EditorData.StateChangeTags: The true soul is lying down

Text.Value: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*
Forget the owlbear. You're still alive - so go.
We know that all too well, sir. But... the Absolute sent us here.
We know that all too well, ma'am. But... the Absolute sent us here.
We know that all too well. But... the Absolute sent us here.
It killed one of us. It killed Edowin. It's an enemy of the Absolute.
You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, ED lies on the ground, injured, obviously delirious. ANDRICK and BRYNNA look him over, beside themselves., ANIMS:_Injured_OnGround_LOOP, _LeaningOver_LOOP
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The true soul is lying down

Text.Value: The beast is dead. You should be on your way.
May the Absolute guide us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Undaunted. Eager to resume her holy mission.

Text.Value: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*
An owlbear. It had him on the ground before we had a chance to react.

EditorData.NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

Text.Value: The Absolute is our goddess. She's going to rip down the old world order, start a new one.
*Useless. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*
*Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*
I'm a survivor of that crash. Looks like you found me.
*Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*
You...? Brynna - kill him!
You...? Brynna - kill her!
You...? Brynna - kill them!

EditorData.NodeContext: Incredulous, then quickly resolving to attack. The player revealed themselves as his target, Brin-ah.

Text.Value: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Text.Value: The Absolute wants them found. At any cost.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, ED lies dead on the ground., ANIM: _Edowin_Dead_LOOP
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Angle on Andrick glancing at Edowin's corpse on 'at any cost'.
EditorData.NodeContext: Falters slight on 'at any cost', glancing down at his fallen comrade, Edowin.

Text.Value: That fellow was infected, like us. Is this the mark of a True Soul?
Explain this Absolute to me.
*Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*
What happened to your brother exactly?
He's with the Absolute now.

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, ANDRICK, seeing his brother dead, slowly stands to his feet., ANIM: _ChecksOnEd_Rise
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Text.Value: We don't know what they look like, but anyone who survived that crash is bound to be injured. That's enough to get us started.
Please. Any supposed new god would have an uphill battle.
I don't know any druids.
*The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*
It seems the Absolute still has a great deal to teach me.
He's wounded. I'd like to help - if you'll let me.
You're right, sir. The beast must be destroyed.
You're right, madam. The beast must be destroyed.
You're right. The beast must be destroyed.
Try to flee.
Protect them.
Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

Text.Value: He is a True Soul. Mind him. He will - he - he...
She is a True Soul. Mind her. She will - she - she...
They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*
EditorData.NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The Character (Edowin) die after the dialog.

Text.Value: What?!
A True Soul - like you - has been chosen by the Absolute. You speak with Her voice.
*As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
*The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*
May the Absolute continue to guide your hand, sir. As for us, we won't take any more of your time.
May the Absolute continue to guide your hand, madam. As for us, we won't take any more of your time.
May the Absolute continue to guide your hand. As for us, we won't take any more of your time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amazed, with a dash of religious fervour.

Text.Value: His wounds look deep. I might be able to help.
The cave is just ahead. It was too much for us before, but... but if you could help us, True Soul... we may stand a chance.
Then we'll be the ones with the power - well, you will firstly, True Soul. You don't need me to explain that.
You need to find the beast and avenge your brother.
Mind the True Soul. He will - he - he...
Mind the True Soul. She will - she - she...
Mind the True Soul. They will - they - they...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*
EditorData.NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.
EditorData.StateChangeTags: Murat - True soul already lying on the ground die.

Text.Value: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*
He might be a healer, Bry.
She might be a healer, Bry.
They might be a healer, Bry.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to convice sister.

Text.Value: What...? Are you... are you testing us?
I'm so, so sorry. It's our brother - True Soul Edowin. He's injured, and I... I wasn't thinking.
Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?
And when the time comes, the True Souls - you - will rule.
You should get out of here.
Don't you recognise a True Soul when you see one?
*A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*
A crude summary. You have more to learn of our faith, novice.
I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?

EditorData.AnimationTags: CMitchell:, As Andrick speaks, BRYNNA catches sight of the player and whirls around with a start., ANIMS: _Injured_OnGround_LOOP [DUPE], _Startled_180
EditorData.StateChangeTags: The true soul is lying down

Text.Value: What happened to your friend?
Perhaps you can help me. I'm looking for the druid Halsin.
*The injured man locks eyes with you. The parasite writhes in your head.*
We're looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.
You're mistaken - I'm no True Soul.
Your words are Her command. She grants you the power to enforce Her will.
Oh, I like these two. All zeal and no brains.

EditorData.NodeContext: Nearly hungry tone. He's ready to take advantage of their belief in him.

Text.Value: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Text.Value: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*
Leave.
Bah. I will serve at no ruler's side but my queen's.
An owlbear. Please, do you have any -
I will go where I wish.
We managed to drag him away, but the beast's claws had already done their work.

EditorData.NodeContext: Upset, recounting his comrade's gruesome death

Text.Value: Brother - your sword!
He might be a bandit.
She might be a bandit.
They might be a bandit.

EditorData.NodeContext: She is resolved not to let player come any closer. (the 'he' refers to player here).

Synopsis: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
